scripts.say: We lost, but... it was still fun.
Even if we ignore the Muse System, fighting while taking the stage performance aspect into consideration a departure from what we're used to.
I felt like we were actually having fun with each other rather than battling as warships. As a result, I was able to push my limits further than usual.
Heheh! You have Sister Sara's special training to thank for that!
Yes. Considering we were just two destroyers, we put up a very good fight.
Ayanami, let's go join up with Javelin and the others?
Ah, everyone in Polaris, don't worry about us! Keep moving on to your next test!
Observation: In live combat, the performance of Muse System differs from default specifications.
Yeah, there's no doubt that fighting with the Muse System feels different. I'd say that it's a bit easier to use...
Agreed. There should be virtually no substantial differences in how our equipment handles.
Gascogne's combat operation patterns do not differ from specifications in trials and simulations.
Hmm, in other words, you haven't changed the way you fight, but you can still tell that the equipment handles differently?
Affirmative.
What Gascogne said is convincing... This Muse System is fundamentally different from the regular equipment we use.
(As I expected... As Kansen, our equipment does not vary significantly as long as it's constrained by our hull and core structure.)
(Until today, the Muse System did not perform much differently from our normal equipment...)
(That means that whatever phenomenon triggered this was not present before.)
(In that case, what is the reason behind this phenomenon...? What was different about today?)
The following information is highly speculative and may not be worthy of reference:
When carrying out anti-Siren combat protocols, Gascogne's emotion module is often suppressed as much as possible in order to stabilize combat efficacy.
In the previous test battle, the emotion module was suppressed as part of normal combat protocol.
However, activity in emotion module was still significantly higher than normal.
Sorry, but I didn't catch any of that...
In other words, you were having fun, right?
You're way too roundabout with how you talk...
Offering apologies for my explanation method. "I'm sorry."
However, in the event that activation of Gascogne's emotion module is necessary for the equipment testing...
Please issue the command.
